Thanks Joel.  I'm not sure that's the problem anymore, though, as the leads=
 appear to be intact.


 
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: joel smit=
h<mailto:sparky1j41@...> 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-IT=
C@yahoogroups.com> 
  Sent: Saturday, January 05, 2008 9:33 PM
  Subject: R=
e: [EVP-ITC] Check out what I broke this time


  you can buy new leads  at=
 rs  for like` $2.00  and get it to work

  Robin Henson <MudPuddleFarm@msn=
.com<mailto:MudPuddleFarm@...>> wrote: 

    After viewing Mike's RS 12=
-469 hack video for the fifth time I felt 
    ready to take the plunge mys=
elf, so yesterday while dh was picking up 
    a pizza at Papa John's I sne=
aked next door and bought the radio. He 
    couldn't stop complaining abou=
t how I'd wasted money on a perfectly 
    good piece of equipment only to =
wreck it for my dumb hobby, but once 
    we got home he took it upon himse=
lf to test it and make sure it 
    worked. For some reason it really DIDN'=
T work, so he took it back to 
    RS and exchanged it for another one, and=
 after making sure THAT one 
    worked he even offered to help me with the=
 modification. "No thanks" 
    I told him. "I think I need to do this myse=
lf." 

    I can't pretend the process went as smoothly as I'd hoped, but 
=
    finally I was done and making the last turn in the second screw of 
   =
 the circuit board.. and then.. The whole thing flew out of my hands 
    a=
nd both battery wires ripped away from their soldered ends in the 
    casi=
ng. It was all Bob could do to keep from gleefully yelling "I 
    knew you=
 were going to break it!" But then I guess he felt bad 
    because he ran =
down to Walmart and got a soldering iron and solder 
    and spent an hour =
trying to put it all back together for me. 

    It's dead as a doornail, a=
nd I'm thinking that if I could break it 
    that easily without even know=
ing how or why, maybe I'm not supposed 
    to pursue this method (sigh). I=
 guess I'll just think it over and 
    maybe try again later. 

    Thanks=
 for all the helpful information though Mike!

    Robin
